  • Method Details

    • wordParser

      public void wordParser() throws Exception
      This method initializes a list of the top 20 words in the Raven poem. This method does not return anything or use parameters.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getText

      public String getText() throws Exception
      This method gets the text from the poem using a built in jsoup parser.
      Returns:
      Throws:
      Exception

    • uglyRegex

      public static String uglyRegex(String text)
      The reason I used this long regex was because all other single line variations were deleting characters that should not have been deleted. Some characters in the poem were showing up as something different in eclipse. I created this to manually have more control over what I was removing form the poem.
      Parameters:
      text - This takes in the poem as a String and removes unwanted characters.
      Returns:

    • removeApo

      public static List<String> removeApo(String[] words)
      Removes Apostrophe from list of unique words.I added this separate because words like "demon's" were becoming "demon s".
      Parameters:
      words - takes in the poem after going through the `uglyRegex` method.
      Returns:
      the list without apostrophes.

    • uniqueList

      public static List<String> uniqueList(List<String> wordList)
      Creates a list of unique words
      Parameters:
      wordList - the list after its gone through an extensive regex formula.
      Returns:
      a list of unique words.

    • countWordFreq

      public static Hashtable<String,Integer> countWordFreq(List<String> wordsU, List<String> wordList)
      This method counts the frequency of each word by comparing the list of unique words against the list of all the words in The Raven. In the future I want to re write this to use something other than Hashtable.
      Parameters:
      wordsU - word
      wordList -
      Returns:
      a map that has the unique words and their frequencies.

    • sortList

      public static List<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> sortList(Hashtable<String,Integer> wordMap)
      This method allows the list to be sorted using collections built in sort method. I found this method at https://www.javacodeexamples.com/sort-hashtable-by-values-in-java-example/3169
      Parameters:
      wordMap - takes in the wordMap of unique words and their frequency.
      Returns:
      returns a list of the wordMap in order of frequency.

    • formatList

      public static void formatList(List<Map.Entry<String,Integer>> list) throws FileNotFoundException
      This method takes the sorted list and prints it to the user in a visually pleasing manner.
      Parameters:
      list - takes in the sorted list of unique words and their frequency.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if there is no list an exception will be thrown.
